intro: Jussiaea nubica, commonly known as the cloud willow, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, often pendulous stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in mountainous regions with rocky or sandy soils. Jussiaea nubica is adapted to harsh alpine conditions, making it a resilient and specialized species in its native habitat.
